subject: Philosophy
title: The Four Noble Truths
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Four Noble Truths.

hook.text: A sheltered prince left his palace, saw suffering for the first time, and changed the world.

buildup.text: Siddhartha Gautama became the Buddha after years of searching for the root of human suffering.

discovery.text: His answer: life is suffering, desire causes it, suffering can end, and the path is the Eightfold Path.

twist.text: The goal isn't happiness in the Western sense. It's nirvana â€” the cessation of craving and clinging.

climax.text: Twenty-five hundred years later, these four truths remain the foundation of all Buddhist thought.

punchline.text: Suffering has a cause. That means it has a cure.

quiz.question: What does the Second Noble Truth identify as the cause of suffering?
